intro: Lochnera rosea var. angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lochnera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
